definition: long or drawn out/remote in time or space/leisurely/to swing/pensive/worried
long or drawn out/remote in time or space/leisurely/to swing/pensive/worried

sentences.english: Grandpa drank his coffee so slowly, and it tasted good.
sentences.chinese: 爺爺在慢悠悠地喝着他的咖啡，味道好極了。

sentences.english: He pedaled his bicycle slowly up the hill.
sentences.chinese: 他慢悠悠地騎着自行車上山。

sentences.english: He drew the first whiff of smoke deep into his lungs and expelled it in a long and lingering exhalation.
sentences.chinese: 他把第一口煙深深地吸進肺以再慢悠悠地吐了出來。

sentences.english: Mrs. Maylie being fatigued, they returned more slowly home.
sentences.chinese: 梅萊太太覺得有點累了，她們才慢悠悠地回到家裏。

sentences.english: The Lan Hui was alsooffended fish to after entering water also slowly and longly return four elder brother that.
sentences.chinese: 瀾惠見怪魚進水後也慢悠悠的返回了四阿哥那。

sentences.english: Through the window, she saw Anderson saunter over.
sentences.chinese: 透過車窗玻璃，她看到安德森慢悠悠地踱過來。
阿濟茲慢悠悠地走到花園去。

sentences.english: The questioning went on, the man keeping up his slow pacing.
sentences.chinese: 審問在繼續，那個德國人繼續慢悠悠地踱着步。

definition: calm and unhurried (idiom); composed/to take matters calmly
see 悠哉悠哉[you1 zai1 you1 zai1]
neither too fast nor too slow (idiom)
see 悠哉悠哉[you1 zai1 you1 zai1]
with one's hands clasped behind one's back
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
